title: Audiosear.ch
description:
The Audiosear.ch API requires OAuth, which you can manage at OAuth Applications.
API SDK clients available in Python, Ruby, PHP, Node, Java, and Swift.
Read the API Cookbook for easy copy-and-paste recipes.

start_date.name: start_date
start_date.description: The start date of the charts data in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Maximum (and default) date is the most recent chart date minus one week; earliest is 2013-06-01)

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The highest ranks for which to get data. Default is 10, maximum is 100.

country.name: country
country.description: The country for which to get charts data. US: 'us', Great Britain: 'gb', Ireland: 'ie', New Zealand: 'nz', South Africa: 'za'

200.description: Chart ranks of shows listed by title

methods.description: Returns shows that have been in the top 100 on the iTunes charts and their ranks
Gets a single episode record by ID

size.name: size
size.description: Number of episodes to be returned. Must be paired with from.

from.name: from
from.description: Offset of result from which to start (zero-based). Must be paired with size.

methods.description: Returns episodes related to a given episode
Returns a specific moment from an episode with two lines of context.

time_in_secs.name: time_in_secs
time_in_secs.description: Timestamp of moment in audio in seconds.

methods.description: Gets a single episode record by iTunes ID. (Note: we may not have every episode for every show.)
This endpoint will return the metadata for a single person.
Selects and returns a random episode

filters[network].name: filters[network]
filters[network].description: Limit a search by any field value. This example uses network but any field name could be used. (Note: the filter uses a 'term match, so it returns a result if the field contains the term. It is most reliably used with integer values, such as filters[show_id]=15) Examples: filters[physical_location]=popuparchive or filters[network]=NPR or filters[categories.name]=Talk%20Show.

filters[show_id].name: filters[show_id]
filters[show_id].description: Another example filter, by show id.

filters[with_transcript].name: filters[with_transcript]
filters[with_transcript].description: Add this filter (no value required) to filter out episodes with no transcript.

sort_by.name: sort_by
sort_by.description: Sort results by any field value. The default is by the relevancy score (_score). Must be paired with sort_order.

sort_order.name: sort_order
sort_order.description: Sort direction. Must be either asc or desc. Must be paired with sort_by.

s.name: s
s.description: Shortcut for specifying sort_by and sort_order in a single value. E.g. date_created desc.

size.name: size
size.description: The number of results in a single page. Default is 10. If present, must be paired with from.

from.name: from
from.description: Offset when doing manual pagination. Must be paired with size.

page.name: page
page.description: The page number of results. Default is 1.

related.name: related
related.description: Set to positive integer to include an array of N related episodes for each search result

query.name: query
query.description: Thing you would like to search for. A wildcard character (`*`) can be used to substitute for any other character or characters in a string. Submitting `*` will return all results. To restrict the query to a single field, preface the query with the field name followed by `:`, (e.g. `title: roller coaster` or `itunes_episode:348644077` or `entity:Obama`).

filters[shows.id].name: filters[shows.id]
filters[shows.id].description: Limit a search by any field value. This example uses shows.id but any field name could be used. E.g. filters[shows.id]=123 or filters[episode.id]=456.

sort_by.name: sort_by
sort_by.description: Sort results by any field value. The default is by the relevancy score (_score). Must be paired with sort_order.

sort_order.name: sort_order
sort_order.description: Sort direction. Must be either asc or desc. Must be paired with sort_by.

s.name: s
s.description: Shortcut for specifying sort_by and sort_order in a single value. E.g. name desc.

size.name: size
size.description: The number of results in a single page. Default is 10. If present, must be paired with from.

from.name: from
from.description: Offset when doing manual pagination. Must be paired with size.

page.name: page
page.description: The page number of results. Default is 1.

query.name: query

To restrict the query to a single field, preface the query with the field name followed by `:`, (e.g. `title: radio`).

methods.description: This endpoint will return the medatdata for a single show.
Returns shows related to the supplied show.
Returns in-depth statistics for the supplied show.
This endpoint will return the medatdata for a single show given its iTunes id. (Note: we do not have every show in iTunes's database)
Returns search results based on what podcast tastemakers are talking about filtered by tastemaker source.
Returns search results based on what podcast tastemakers are talking about.
This endpoint returns search results based on what tastemakers are talking about.
Returns episodes related to trending terms from Twitter
